channel.title: Your dream game?
channel.description:
I'm not sure if anyone has visions of a game they would love to play, but so far mine has not came true (at least not that i properly know of)
Picture quake3, inside a huge MMO type of map, where you see other players, need to go mine, smith to create your own weapons etc, have combat levels (basically something like runescape, crossed with a great first person shooter such as quake3)
Wilderness, bring clans to go own other players in the huge world..
the creator of a game like this would become one rich fucker. I heard Tabula rasa is somewhat like this, but apparently that failed.

item.title: Your dream game?
item.dc:creator: @PeterMan PeterMan
item.description:
@PeterMan wrote:

[quote=“Tenac, post:42, topic:264940”][quote author=PeterMan link=topic=349795.msg2797368#msg2797368 date=1243152280]

Halo 3 taking place in a world like World of Warcraft, hundreds of people to interact with, do missions/quests with, fast, real-time FPS fighting, lots of weapons and armors, I don’t think anything like this will be created in a really, really long time, but I love the idea of thinking about it.

Some game called Tabula Rasa has tried
[/quote]
Haha, “tried”, I put some thought into it, and it does sound hard to do such a huge game, but if someone can somehow find a way to mix the dynamics of Halo 3 into the vast world of World of Warcraft, I would play that every day for the rest of my life.

EDIT: That game doesn’t look too terrible, but in my mind I’m thinking a First Person perspective mostly, not third person.[/quote]
I’m not sure, but I think they got 1st person in it aswell.

Read full topic

item.title: Your dream game?
item.dc:creator: @Tenac Tenac
item.description:
@Tenac wrote:

[quote=“PeterMan, post:41, topic:264940”][quote author=Tenac link=topic=349795.msg2797366#msg2797366 date=1243151849]
Halo 3 taking place in a world like World of Warcraft, hundreds of people to interact with, do missions/quests with, fast, real-time FPS fighting, lots of weapons and armors, I don’t think anything like this will be created in a really, really long time, but I love the idea of thinking about it.
[/quote]
Some game called Tabula Rasa has tried[/quote]
Haha, “tried”, I put some thought into it, and it does sound hard to do such a huge game, but if someone can somehow find a way to mix the dynamics of Halo 3 into the vast world of World of Warcraft, I would play that every day for the rest of my life.

EDIT: That game doesn’t look too terrible, but in my mind I’m thinking a First Person perspective mostly, not third person.

Read full topic

item.title: Your dream game?
item.dc:creator: @Wrauld Wrauld
item.description:
@Wrauld wrote:

RSC - That IS my dream game. The graphics were the best, the swords, the armor, the bronze bars look like paper metal :).

Too bad I only got to play a couple of months of it, then RS2 came out, and meh. Ended.

I was only 6 or 7 at the time.

Read full topic

item.title: Your dream game?
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

Moparisthebest:

Where a blue screen of death means actual death?

Well if only the internet was a pack of truth it would be.

Uncyclopedia

Blue Screen of Death

The Blue Screen of Death (abbreviated BSoD or WTFomgBLUESTD), also known as The Blue Screen of Doom, the "Blue Screen of Fun" or "Phatul Exception: The WRECKening", the great blue yonder is an award-winning game first developed in 1995 by Microsoft....

Read full topic

I would love to play a game with a little round circle who is yellow. It would have a little mouth and have to eat these pellet like objects and avoid some form of enemy. Perhaps a ghost?
[/quote]

thats more like 3 better

item.title: Your dream game?
item.dc:creator: @PeterMan PeterMan
item.description:
@PeterMan wrote:

[quote=“SomethingToHide, post:30, topic:264940”]And Grand Theft Auto. But kinda virtual reality. You get in the game so you are the one in the game. You feel everything but it doesn’t hurt. Like you fly around with the car crashes but don’t actually die or feel pain, more like a small ant bite or something. And have it so big that it’s JUST like real life. You need gas. You can kill people and take their car keys so you don’t have to break in. Of course everything’s first person.

Or instead of the game, it uses your area code or you thoughts to produce the place you live and everything in it. So you go in the game and it’s exactly like your life except you can’t die or be hurt.[/quote]
Dude, we must be related or something.

Read full topic

item.title: Your dream game?
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

Two.

Game like Fight Night. Little better graphics. But mix it with a street fighting game. Outside environments with lots of people watching. Pick up random shit. Everything is thug and black. Awesome clothing though. Not fashion-wise, but graphics wise. I just really want that.

And Grand Theft Auto. But kinda virtual reality. You get in the game so you are the one in the game. You feel everything but it doesn’t hurt. Like you fly around with the car crashes but don’t actually die or feel pain, more like a small ant bite or something. And have it so big that it’s JUST like real life. You need gas. You can kill people and take their car keys so you don’t have to break in. Of course everything’s first person.

Or instead of the game, it uses your area code or you thoughts to produce the place you live and everything in it. So you go in the game and it’s exactly like your life except you can’t die or be hurt.

Read full topic

item.title: Your dream game?
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

My dream game has always been one that is constantly going on. Kind of like Tom Clancy’s End War. You choose a side, and fight with that side, constantly ranking up. Till you get to a position where you command armies, etc.

That’s not exactly like my dream game, but similar to it. I really just want to see a game that is always going on, and when you do something, it’ll affect the future.

Read full topic

The Matrix.
